title: HOLIDAY SALE: LIKE US ON FB, ALL BSA PRODUCTS $12
description:
Happy Holidays! BSA is happy to announce the beginning of its Holiday Sale for all products: umbrellas, tote bags, and a variety of t-shirts. By liking Brown Student Agencies on Facebook, you can purchase any of these items for only $12! Now you can buy the Brown gear your friends and family want, but for less $$!

To receive the discount, go to BSA's Facebook page, like it, and click the "tshirt coupon" tab. Then just print the coupon and present it at the info desk! Happy holiday shopping!

title: Boren Scholarship Info Session
description: If you are interested in learning about the Boren Scholarship, plan to attend this info session in the Office of International Programs on Thursday, December 13, 2012 at 4:00pm in JWW 440.

title: Reminder: Workday 18 System Update
description: To allow for the release of the Workday 18 update, the Workday system will be unavailable beginning Friday, December 14, at 9:00pm. Faculty and staff may log back into Workday on Monday, December 17, at 8:00am. Please plan accordingly.

title: **Christmas Party**TOMORROW
description:
Come celebrate Christmas TOMORROW, 12/14 @ 7:30PM in the warm, historic Judson House (168 Lloyd Ave., 2 blocks past CVS) with good food, good fun, and good company. We will be serving classic Christmas goodies from different parts of the world, playing games, decorating a Christmas tree and reading the Christmas story. There'll be a gingerbread house making competition, so come ready with ideas, and bring teammates! All are invited! FREE!

WHEN: 7:30-9:30 PM
WHERE: 168 Lloyd Ave.

title: BEO Intn'tl Internships, Application deadline
description: If you are a BEO sophomore or junior interested in the BEO International Internship program, this is just a reminder that applications are due this Friday, 12/14. You can submit applications via email to christine_sprovieri@brown.edu or drop them off at the BEO office in Sayles 015.

title: Brown Jug Tradition Issue: It's Out Now!
description: Check out the Brown Jug Traditions Issue. The Brown Jug is a humor magazine--it's as old as time! Read the newest one, all the magazine stands have it.

title: LAST DAY TO GET YOUR BASKETBALL TICKETS
description: Today, December 13, is the last day to pick up your FREE men's basketball ticket for the home game against Providence College on December 28. Please stop at the Brown Ticket Office before 5 p.m. with the Brown Card to pick up your ticket.

title: GIFT SALE for Mali Health Wed. and Thurs. in JWW
description: Super cool t-shirts, beautiful jewelry, donations to an awesome cause -- find them all at the Mali Health Organizing Project's gift sale in the JWW lobby this  Wednesday (12/13) and Thursday (12/14) from 11am-1pm. Come help us raise money to build a maternity ward in West Africa, while getting great, inexpensive gifts for all of the people in your life!

title: Apply to the BDH Editorial Page Board!
description: We are currently accepting applications for next semester's BDH Editorial Page Board! The Editorial Page Board is comprised of five members, and we are responsible for the editorials, which appear each daily issue of the Herald. If you have a strong interest in Brown, local and national issues, we encourage you to apply! For an application, please contact Daniel_Jeon@brown.edu. We look forward to reading your application!

title: Apply: Summer@Brown and Sports Camp RA Postions
description:
Applications are now being accepted for Summer@Brown and Sports Camp RA positions. The deadline for applications is February 4

For more information and application materials visit: http://reslife.brown.edu/summer_staff/selection/index.html

title: selfservice.brown.edu with SHAG tonight, 7pm
description: The SHAG Series of Unmentionable Events presents selfservice.brown.edu, tonight, Thursday, 12/13, at 7pm! Join SHAG to discuss + demystify masturbation. Is it something I only do alone? What role can it play with a partner? How can you masturbate when you have a roommate? What are the health benefits? Get these + your other questions answered. FREE pizza + safer sex supplies! Just a few spots left! To register, e-mail shag@brown.edu. Location will be sent with your registration confirmation.

title: ------------->EDIT and WRITE for THE TRIPLE HELIX!
description:
Ever read an article in Time or the NY Times and thought "WOW. That's so cool"? WELL, you're in luck! The Triple Helix is looking for EDITORS and WRITERS interested in SCIENCE, SOCIAL ISSUES or LAW!

If you want to edit feature-length articles and work closely with writers, email BROWN@TheTripleHelix.ORG for an application to be an Associate Editor in the Spring! Also, if you're also interested in writing, shoot us an email and we'll contact you next semester with details! DO IT!

title: BIOL1200: Protein Biophysics & Structural Biology
description: Spring 2013: BIOL1200, Protein Biophysics & Structural Biology: The field of structural biology is one of the most rapidly developing fields. Structure Based Drug Design has already lead to multiple drugs such as HIV protease inhibitor cocktails, flu, and arthritis medicine. Prereq: BIOL 0280. If interested please come to the first meeting on Tuesday 1/29 from 8:30am-9:00am at BioMed Center (BMC) Room 305. Regular class days and time will be determined based on the needs of the students.

title: Call for submissions: 2013 Pingree Prize
description:
The David Pingree Prize in Ancient Science and Intellectual History
Instituted by Isabelle Pingree and Brown University in 2011 to honor the distinguished career of her late husband Professor David E. Pingree, University Professor and Professor of the History of Mathematics and of Classics at Brown University until his death in 2005.

title: Boren Scholarship Info Session
description: If you are interested in learning about the Boren Scholarship, plan to attend this info session in the Office of International Programs on Wednesday, December 12, 2012 at 12:00 noon in JWW 440.

title: Pick up a Copy of the Brown Political Review!
description:
Want to read what your fellow peers have to say about the current state of local, national, and international affairs?

If so, then pick up a copy of the Brown Political Review, a political magazine sponsored by the Political Theory Project. Copies of the magazine will be available this week in Faunce, J. Walter Wilson, and in the dining halls. Get your copy today!

title: Staff Holiday Party TODAY in Sayles Hall, 12-2pm
description: The Staff Holiday Party is TODAY December 12 in Sayles Hall.  All Brown staff are invited to attend this festive celebration in honor of their hard work all year. Food and entertainment will be provided. Stop by anytime between noon and 2 p.m. to enjoy this event with your colleagues. A great way to end the fall semester and begin the holiday season!

title: Cookies, Hot Chocolate, Crafts: Study Break TODAY!
description: Don't let finals get you down! Give yourself a break from studying and come join us for Meeting St. cookies, hot chocolate, and simple crafts. It's a perfect way to unwind and recharge. Drop in from 1-4PM TODAY (12/12/12) at Faunce Memorial Room 229. Brought to you by The Student Volunteers for the Samaritans of Rhode Island.

title: Food Recovery Network: Snack Donation Frenzy!
description: (FRN- part of HOPE) Send some holiday cheer to the women's and children's shelter and give back to the Providence community by donating snacks at Jo's! Thursday, December 13th from 8-9 PM, you can use up some extra meal credits, purchase something extra or buy something to use your whole credit. FRN volunteers will be standing by to answer any questions

title: BOOKSTORE HOLIDAY SALE ENDS SUNDAY
description:
The Brown Bookstore Holiday Sale continues through Sunday, December 16th, featuring discounts from 20% to 50% on a wide variety of merchandise!

Sale is in-store only. Some exclusions apply. Quantities are limited.

For more information call x3-3168.

Hours:
Mon�Fri 7:30�8 � Sat 10�8 � Sun 10�6
(Textbook Department & Technology Center close at 6pm daily)

title: Write & Make Art for Watershed Journal this Winter
description: Watershed Journal, Brown and RISD's publication of Environment and Culture, seeks submissions of Art, Photography, Poetry, and Prose. Have an idea for a piece? E-mail us at Watershed_Journal@brown.edu with thoughts and questions. We would love to work with you over winter break to create something wonderful.

title: /~/~/~/~/~/~ LEAVETAKERS PIZZA STUDY BREAK 1 PM
description: Calling past, present, potential leavetakers AND CATS to come to the Curricular Resource Center, Room 228 in Faunce, TODAY 12/12 at 1 PM - 2 PM for a PIZZA STUDY BREAK!

title: JCB Fellows Lunch! (12/12)
description:
The John Carter Brown Library will host a lunch chat at Brown RISD Hillel on December 12th at 12:00 p.m. Linda Sturtz, from Beloit College, will give a talk entitled, "Sett-Girls, Calemba, and Myal: Contextualizing African-Jamaican Women´s Musical Processions in the Pre-Emancipation Period". Linda is the National Endowment for the Humanities Fellow at the John Carter Brown Library.

Please bring your own lunch to Hillel. The talk will begin at 12:30 p.m

title: Study Break With A4 TODAY (12/12)
description:
Come out and take a break from work with the Pan Asian Council (PAC) and representatives of the Asian/Asian American Alumni Alliance (A4), as we video chat with Channa Srey (Outreach Officer). This is a great chance for you to learn more about A4 and opportunities for you to get involved with A4.

There will be plenty of HOT CHOCOLATE and MEETING STREET cookies for everyone. The event is open to ALL (especially Seniors)!

WHERE: Petteruti Lounge
WHEN: Dec 12 (Wed) 7 pm

title: FREE, anonymous HIV testing THURSDAY, 12/13, 1-3
description: Health Services is offering anonymous, drop-in HIV testing for Brown students tomorrow, Thursday, 12/13, from 1pm-3pm, at the LGBTQ Center on the 3rd floor of the Campus Center. No appointment needed. No blood draw needed. Drop by on your lunch break! Results available in 40 minutes or less. The CDC recommends that all sexually active people get tested for HIV at least once a year.

title: Sign-ups NOW OPEN for SPRING MARKET SHARES
description: The Brown Market Shares Program is now accepting sign-ups for our SPRING SHARE! BMSP provides weekly shares of LOCAL, SUSTAINABLE produce, dairy, bread, eggs, and meat to members of the Brown community. The spring share runs ten weeks from February 7th to April 18th (excluding spring break). For more information and to sign up for a share, please visit our website below. Spots are limited and sign-ups/payment must be received by FEBRUARY 1st. A limited number of subsidized shares are available.

title: Summer Session 2013 Course Catalog Now Available
description:
Summer 2013 Course Catalog is now available, listing over 50 courses
for browsing.

Anticipate small class sizes, dynamic discussions, friendly student support, and plenty of time with your instructor during Brown's Summer Session. Begin your planning for the early registration period in April.

title: Cookies and Cider to Keep You Going
description: The Office of the Chaplains and Religious Life knows that the end of the semester is challenging, so we'd like to give you a little treat. Come by J. Walter Wilson Room 411 on Wednesday, December 12 or Thursday, December 13 anytime after 4:00pm. We'll have hot cider and cookies waiting for you!

title: Leave of Absence/December Completes
description:
If you are taking a leave of absence during 2nd semester, you need to file a mail forwarding request in Banner at My Personal Information page. This applies to educational as well as personal leaves. You also need to understand that you may lose your mailbox assignment while on leave and will be reassigned when you return to campus as an active student.
If you don't file a mail forwarding request all mail received while you are on leave will be returned to sender.
Thank you, Mail Services

title: December Completes
description:
If you have completed your degree requirements in December, you may use your mailbox during 2nd semester providing mail is picked up at least once a week.
If you will not be in Providence during 2nd semester, please file a mail forwarding request in Banner at My Personal Information page. The length of time that we'll forward mail will be Dec 2012 to Aug 2014. If you have any questions, please wtire to Mail_Services@brown.edu

title: Brown Men's Basketball hosts Providence College
description: The men's basketball team hosts the Providence College Friars for the first time at the Pizzitola Sports Center on Friday, December 28 at 7 p.m. Plenty of good seats are still available in the general admission endzones. Tickets are $12 for adults and $5 for children 12 and under. To order your tickets, call the ticket office at 401-863-2773, stop by the ticket office, located at the Pizzitola Center, or online at BrownBears.com.

title: Research Paper Help: Librarians After Dark Wed/Thu
description:
Working on a research paper? Stuck or want to dig up some new resources for your project? Not sure how to create your bibliography?

Extra help with subject librarians is available in the Friedman Center between 7-9 pm tonight, Wednesday 12/12 and tomorrow night Thursday 12/13. Drop in to get one-on-one research help.

When: Wednesday December 12, 7-9 pm
Thursday December 13, 7-9 pm
Where: Friedman Center, Level A in SciLi

Librarians After Dark is sponsored by the University Library

title: Update Your Voicemail Greeting for Winter Break
description:
Now is a good time to update your voicemail greeting for the winter break. Please remember to include your name and department in your voicemail greeting.

To change your voicemail greeting:

Dial 3-9000
Enter Password
Dial 4, 3, 1, 2, 1
Record Greeting
Press #
Press # one more time to confirm.

Check out our voicemail manual on-line at https://wiki.brown.edu/confluence/display/CISDOC/Voicemail+Guide

or call Telecom at 3-2007.

title: *TODAY* code4change: Tech, Entrepreneurship,Change
description:
Interested in Technology, Entrepreneurship and Social Change?

Want to use your coding skills for social good?

Want to intern in a NGO in Kenya?

Come to Code4change info session:
1pm, Wed Dec 12
CIT, Lubrano Room 477

Code4change networks students with 4 Kenyan NGOs and gives students the opportunity to apply their technological skills for social change in Kenya. Code4change is sponsored by the Swearer Centre for Public Service.

RSVP http://bit.ly/WYBHhw
Email achew@cs.brown.edu

title: DESIGN A BROWN T-SHIRT & WIN SOME $$$
description:
Have a great idea for a Brown t-shirt design? Submit it to reach@brown.edu with the subject line "T-shirt submission". Please send high quality design images. If you win, your t-shirt will be produced and sold at the Campus Center Info Desk! You will also be compensated for your design if it is chosen!

So send in a design, and possibly make some $$$! Submit as soon as possible.

title: TODAY: Center for Study of Slavery &Justice
description:
Center for the Study of Slavery and Justice
Opening Reception
December 11, 2012
4:00-5:00 PM
Crystal Room
Alumnae Hall
194 Meeting Street
Open to the entire Brown community

Please join us for an opening reception to celebrate the Center for the Study of Slavery and Justice (CSSJ)'s inaugural year. Learn more about CSSJ and upcoming events in Spring 2013!

All are welcome!

To learn more about CSSJ please visit: http://brown.edu/slaveryandjustice/

title: Study Break Tonight!
description:
Maddock Alumni Center 7pm - Take a break from your studies to relax and refuel with free coffee, tea, fresh fruit and sweets at Maddock Alumni Center!
Tuesday, December 11 from 7pm - 8:30pm.
Bring a Friend!
Sponsored by the Brown Alumni Association

title: Google Tip: A Minimalist Inbox
description: Does your inbox look too cluttered? Follow the link below for settings you may want to change.

title: Library Pizza Nights
description:
Take a break for pizza and more in the Rockefeller Library, tonight, Tuesday, December 11th at 9pm or tomorrow evening in the Sciences Friedman Study Center, Wednesday, December 12th at 9 pm.

Sponsored by Campus Life and the University Library.

title: Round Magazine Reading and Release 12/12/12
description: Please join the Round Magazine for the reading and release of Issue VII on 12/12/12 at 6 p.m., the Brown Bookstore. There'll be copies of the magazine, food, and drink. We hope to see you there!

title: The Critical Review seeks your feedback!
description:
The Critical Review is in the process of evaluating our review system and website, and we'd love to hear from you. Regardless of whether you've found the CR to be helpful or not, please take the time to fill out our feedback form: http://goo.gl/M7teK. Your response is greatly appreciated!

Do feel free to contact us at Critical_Review@brown.edu with questions, comments, and suggestions.

title: Recruiting Spring 2013 Brown Pen Pals
description: Dear Student, fancy writing anonymously to someone and exchanging thoughts? Looking for something fun or philosophical? Does the idea of getting paired with a student pen pal at Brown appeal to you? Get paired, write to each other, and potentially meet! Email us at BrownPenPals@gmail.com if you'd like to be a pen pal next semester. Sincerely, Brown Pen Pal Co-Coordinators. PS: Alums are also welcome to be pen pals.

title: ***DST/KAPsi SEX TRIVIA CHALLENGE!***
description: Need a break from studying? Come out and join the Lambda Iota Chapter of Delta Sigma Theta Sorority, Inc. and the Lambda Xi Chapter of Kappa Alpha Psi Fraternity, Inc. at our SEX TRIVIA CHALLENGE led by Brown SHAG on Wednesday 12/12/12 at 7:00PM in Smitty B, Room 101! Come learn about how to be sexually SAFE throughout your time at Brown while playing an exciting trivia game! Prizes and safe sex giveaways will be distributed! Can't wait to see you there!

title: Brown University Polo Club
description: Ever ridden a horse? Ever thought about riding a horse? Brown Polo Club wants YOU to come out and give polo a try! For more information please email brownpoloclub@gmail.com and check out our Facebook page.

title: Indy! Indy! Indy! Apply to be an Editor!
description:
Interested in editing? Interested in local reporting, literary nonfiction, putting together a paper publication? The College Hill Independent—Rhode Island´s second largest weekly newspaper—is now accepting applications. We´re looking for section editors, illustrators, designers, and web gurus.

For more information or for applications email us at theindy@gmail.com

Deadline is this Sunday, December 16th, at 11:59 pm!

title: TEXTBOOK RENTAL RETURNS ALERT
description:
The Brown Bookstore would like to remind students that the Fall 2012 semester textbook rental returns deadline is Friday, December 21st.

Textbook rentals returned after this date are subject to a late penalty.

For questions please email: textbooks@brown.edu, or call the textbook department at 863-2270.

title: Tur-Duck-In!  Executive Chef Demonstration
description: Join the Faculty Club's Executive Chef, Dave Chabot, today, Tuesday, December 11 at 5:00 p.m. and discover the secret to preparing this seasonal holiday favorite dish! Chef Dave will provide recipes and interactive discussion as well as tasty samples. Warm Cran-Apple Mulled Cider will also be served. This class is only $9.95 per person inclusive. Please call 863-3023 to reserve your space for this special demonstration!

title: &@&>> APPLY TO EDIT INDY SCIENCE <<&@&
description: The College Hill Independent is seeking Science editors (and other editors!) for Spring 2013. Care about science, technology, medicine, or the environment? Want to help shape an alternative point of view on local and global issues? Edit Indy Science! E-mail indyscience@gmail.com with questions and to get an application. APPLICATIONS DUE Sunday, December 16 at 11:59pm.

title: Summer Study Abroad General Info Session
description: If you are interested in summer study abroad, plan to attend this Summer Study Abroad General Info Session in the Office of International Programs on Tuesday, December 11, 2012 at 4:00pm in J. Walter Wilson 440.

title: Exciting New Medieval Course Spring 2013
description: Come join an exciting new course in Comparative Literature/Medieval Studies! COLT 1813H: "God, Sex, and Grammar: Literary Ethics in Medieval Europe." Reading some of the great authors of the medieval world—including Chaucer, Dante, and Christine de Pizan—this course will explore what it means to read and write ethically, and how literary ethics relate to areas such as religion, sexuality, capitalism, and more. Tu Th 6:30-7:50. Open to undergrads and grads. Contact john_moreau@brown.edu

title: TWC Giving Tree- FINAL WEEK
description:
The Final Week for the TWC Giving Tree - Brown University´s Annual Holiday Gift Drive.

Give a gift to a child in need

Pick up an ornament from a Giving Tree at one of the
locations around campus (locations below).
2) Age and gender of the child is specified on the back.
3) Purchase a gift & wrap it.
4) Attach the ornament back on the gift.
5) Place the gift in any of the Giving Tree boxes on
campus.

title: POST- MAGAZINE SEEKS SECTION EDITORS
description:
Do you have a sparkling wit, a keen editorial eye, and a knack for lining up writers? If yes, Post- Magazine, the weekly arts and culture supplement to the Brown Daily Herald, wants YOU to apply to be a section editor for next semester. Our Features, Arts & Culture, and Lifestyle sections are all seeking editors. Email post.magazine@gmail.com for more information and an application!

Applications are due Friday, December 21.

title: Election Polls Lecture NOON @ Taubman Center
description:
"Polling and the 2012 Presidential Election"
Michael Dimock, Associate Director of Research,
Pew Research Center

The issues, events and values that shaped the 2012 presidential election and an inside look at the challenges and choices public opinion pollsters face in pre-election polling.

DECEMBER 10 AT NOON
Taubman Center for Public Policy, 67 George Street
Light lunch provided

title: TOMORROW: Faculty Life at a Liberal Arts College
description:
4:00-5:30PM
Tuesday, Dec 11
Sheridan Center
96 Waterman St

Come learn how being a professor at a liberal arts college is different from being a faculty member at a research university. Wheaton Associate Provost Gail Sahar will lead this session, along with a Wheaton junior faculty member from the humanities & social sciences and one from the life & physical sciences.

This session is part of the Fall 2012 Academic Job Search Series, organized by the CareerLAB and the Sheridan Center.

title: BROWN GIVES GREEN: Green Goes With Everything!
description: and especially with Rhode Islanders in need. Please support the 2013 Brown Gives Green charities campaign to benefit United Way of RI and The Fund for Community Progress. Click on the link below to pledge directly to either or both organizations. You will even be eligible to win a $25 Bookstore gift certificate if you are a first time donor!

title: TODAY! Climate Change and Health Symposium
description:
CLIMATE CHANGE AND HEALTH SYMPOSIUM

Monday, December 10, 2012
2 � 4 PM

Pembroke Hall, 3rd Floor
(172 Meeting Street)


Keynote Address by Dr. Rick Ostfeld, Senior Scientist, Cary Institute of Ecosystem Studies

"Climate Change and Infectious Disease: point, counterpoint and new approaches"


Catered poster reception featuring climate-health research by scientists from Brown and Marine Biological Lab.

For questions or inquiries on presenting a poster, please email Katherine_Smith@brown.edu

title: Submit art for the new Science Center Exhibit!
description:
DEADLINE TODAY! Call for Submissions for our upcoming Science Center Exhibit: Illuminated Forces. Like the scientist, the artist seeks to help us see in new ways. This exhibit looks at how art can illuminate the principles of science in ways that allow us to better understand and appreciate them.

Deadline: Dec 10th 2012.

Send your artwork to brownsciencecenter@gmail.com or contact for more information.

Selected artwork will be displayed at the Science Center!

title: Reminder: ANY STUDENT GROUP CAN ADVERTISE FREE!
description:
Any student group can advertise their events for free through BSA Billboards! THIS INCLUDES SPORTS TEAMS. We operate 4 LCD screens on campus: in the Ratty, at the info desk, in JWW, and the SciLi.

Want your events promoted to the entire student body? Just send a powerpoint slide following the guidelines specified on our website (link below) and email it to reach@brown.edu by Friday at 5 pm. Your slide will then run for one week, free of charge!

Email reach@brown.edu with questions!

title: Boren Scholarship Info Session
description: If you are interested in learning about the Boren Scholarship, plan to attend this info session in the Office of International Programs on Monday, December 10, 2012 at 4:00pm in JWW 440.

title: Healthy Appetizers! -Cooking Demo
description: With the holidays fast approaching, knowing how to make healthy and delicious appetizers will keep your waistline trim this holiday season. Join Faculty Club, Executive Chef, Dave Chabot for this Wellness At Brown entertaining and delicious sampling of three unique, healthy appetizers that will surprise you, your friends and family. Limit of 45 participants.  Registration opens at 8:30am. Click link.

title: Workday 18 System Update
description: To allow for the release of the Workday 18 update, the Workday system will be unavailable beginning Friday, December 14, at 9:00pm. Faculty and staff may log back into Workday on Monday, December 17, at 8:00am. Please plan accordingly.

title: Shape Up RI.  New & Improved in 2013!
description: Looking for ways to increase your energy, lift your mood, tone muscles, strengthen bones, burn calories and lower your risk of high blood pressure? Get ready for the new & improved Shape Up RI challenge in 2013.  Team up with colleagues, family & friends in SURI's new, year round, team based, 12 month program that will enable participants to engage in three, 8-week fitness challenges throughout the year to help motivate and encourage healthy activities and sustain behavior change.

title: Beinecke Scholarship Campus Deadline - 1/31/2103
description: The Campus Deadline for the Beinecke Scholarship is January 31, 2013. The Beinecke Scholarship is a scholarship for juniors who plan to go on to graduate school in the arts, humanities, or social sciences. Students must have an extremely strong academic record and a plan for graduate school (sense of programs, focus areas). Only students receiving financial aid qualify.

title: Online course evaluations
description:
Please take a moment to complete your online evaluations through Banner self-service at http://selfservice.brown.edu. Once you enter your secure Banner page, click on Course evaluations; you´ll see a list of the participating courses in which you are enrolled.
As is the case with all course evaluations, your comments will be completely confidential. Course instructors will not be able to read your feedback until final grades are submitted.

title: Facsimile Maps Available from the JCB Library!
description:
Announcing the opening of the JCB Library's Online Store just in time for your holiday shopping convenience!
Visit us at www.jcbl.org and buy the world, circa 1676, or at the very least a map showing it. Constellations and planetary orbs delineated!

All posters and books are based on the JCB's collection of rare materials, as well as beautifully produced facsimile maps that make a unique gift for the history buff, book lover, or cartographer in your life.

Or, for yourself!

title: Winter Break Closing Communication
description:
In anticipation of the winter break closing, we have compiled a
departmental summary of information. Please print a copy of this
information and keep it with you to ensure that the break goes smoothly for all. Click on the link below for more details.

title: GREEK Discussion Group Tonight!
description: Looking for a chance to speak Modern Greek? Want to try out your conversation skills, meet other Modern Greek speakers, and learn from your peers? Then join Kouvendoula (chit-chat) TONIGHT! Sunday, December 9th 7pm - 8pm in JWW 202. Sponsored by Brown Language Society.

title: Reminder: brown-bag on Grade Disputes tomorrow
description:
12-1PM
M 12/10
Sheridan Center

Deputy Dean of the College Stephen Lassonde and Associate Dean of the Faculty Janet Blume will lead a brown-bag lunch discussion about dealing with grade disputes. They will discuss University policies on grade disputes and will present some best practices and suggestions for faculty as they deal with students who dispute their grades. They will also discuss the role of the DOC in advising students when they try to challenge a grade.

RSVP at URL below.

title: A Conversation About Cuba
description:
Have you always been curious about that little island 90 miles off our
coast? Do you want to impact and interact with young Cubans on the
island? Join us in a conversation about Cuba TOMORROW Monday 12/10 at 8pm in
WILSON 109 over pastelitos. We have ideas about connecting with Cubans,
and we want to hear what Brown students have to say. Cubans,
Cuban-Americans and non-Cubans all welcome! If you're interested but
can't make it, email julia_longoria@brown.edu.

title: Catholic Mass Times
description: The Brown-RISD Catholic Community will offer Masses this Sunday, 12/29 at 10:30am and 8:30pm. Both Masses are held in Manning Chapel (the second floor of Manning Hall), which is located on the Main Green and can be entered from the Quiet Green. The 10:30am Mass will be followed by a bagel brunch held in Petteruti Lounge in the Campus Center. All students and faculty are welcome to celebrate Mass and afterwards meet the community while enjoying bagels.

title: MIDNIGHT ORGAN CONCERT - TONIGHT!
description:
Hosted by The Higher Keys, the Holiday Midnight Organ Concert is a chance to hear Brown's a cappella groups singing selections from their holiday repertoire, featuring a performance of Handel´s Hallelujah Chorus accompanied by a university organist. This concert is a cozy tradition and student favorite - don't miss out!

This event will be held on TONIGHT at 11:59 p.m. in Sayles Hall. Admission is free.

title: Mr & Miss BSU 2012
description: The Black Student Union, in association with the Black Heritage Series and Black Student Initiative, is proud to present our first annual Mr & Miss BSU Pageant. Contestants representing every year will have the opportunity to show off their beauty, brains, and talent in hopes of winning the title and respect of being crowned Mr & Miss BSU 2012! The pageant will be starting at 6:00PM this Saturday, December 8th, in List Art 120 and will have a $3 entry fee.

title: TONIGHT at 7:30 - On Tap of the Word! Holiday Show
description:
What's on Tap? and WORD! present a collaborative tap dancing and spoken word show TONIGHT, Saturday December 8th, at 7:30 in Salomon 101.

We will channel Gretchen Wieners, among other sources of holiday cheer. Hope to see you there!

title: The BMC Show
description:
Brown Music Co-op hosts the performances of 3 student bands

Who: Dubai, Up Arrow, hey human
Where: The Underground
When: Saturday, December 8, 10:30pm

Free admission with Brown ID; 1 guest per ID

title: One Million Bones: Bone-Making and Free Pizza!
description:
For International Human Rights Day, come by the Kasper multipurpose anytime from 12-2pm on December 10th (Monday)! We are making bones for the One Million Bones project. Click here to learn more and watch a short video:
http://www.onemillionbones.org/

There will be free pizza! We'd love to see you there.

Sponsered by STAND at Brown, GlobeMed at Brown, Brown in Burma, and the Brown Human Rights Report

title: Nneka Performs Live at the Granoff Center
description:
Nneka will give a live acoustic performance on Saturday, December 8th at 8:30pm in the Martinos Auditorium in the Granoff Center at 145 Angell Street. The event is free to Brown University students, faculty and staff.

This is a special North American appearance of the Nigerian born, internationally acclaimed singer/songwriter presented by the 2012 Achebe Colloquium on Africa.

title: BEARY KEYS HOLIDAY CONCERT - TONIGHT!
description:
The Annual Beary Keys Concert features the voices of The Higher Keys, Brown's oldest co-ed a cappella group, and The Bear Necessities, Brown's only all-male all-suspendered group. Take a break from all that studying and come hear your favorite Keys and Bears songs. As always, we promise that there will be a truly "epic" finale. You don't want to miss this!

The concert will be held TONIGHT at 8:00 p.m. in Lower Salomon 001. Free admission. See you there!

title: **TODAY** Teach For India info session at 4 pm
description:
Come learn about the TFI Fellowship and internships opportunities at 4pm today, December 08, in MacMillan 115.

Teach for India is a nationwide movement of outstanding young leaders who teach full-time in low-income schools for two years. As a Teach For India Fellow, you will develop leadership skills, impact social change and connect with others committed to eliminating educational inequity in India.

Sponsored by South Asian Students Association.

title: Today - Bernard I. Fain Lecture in Economics
description:
The Bernard I. Fain Lecture is presented annually by the Department of Economics. This year's lecturer, Jos� Manuel Campa, is Professor of Financial Management at IESE Business School and until recently served as the Secretary of State for Economic Affairs in Spain´s Ministry of Economy and Finance. The title of his talk is "Challenges in the Adjustment of the Euro Area".
Friday, December 7, 2012 4:00 PM - 5:15 PM, Salomon center, Room 001.

title: Economics in the Real World Symposium
description:
The symposium "Economics in the Real World" is organized by the Economics Department. This year the symposium is devoted to the economic crisis in Europe.
The discussion participants are Professor Michael Klein (Tufts University), Nicola Cetorelli, Economist, Federal Reserve Bank of New York, Professor Gauti Eggertsson (Brown University), Professor Jose Manuel Campa (IESE).
December 8, Saturday, 9 am - 12 pm. Salomon Center Room 001.

title: Spring Break in Mississippi
description:
Come hear about a unique opportunity to apply for a spot to study the South in the South for a week and have an experience of a lifetime in the Mississippi Delta and at Tougaloo College.

Professor Francoise Hamlin will meet with interested students on Monday, December 10, 2012 at 12:00 noon.

Location: Churchill House lower level (Africana Studies, 155 Angell Street).

Contact: Professor Francoise Hamlin.

title: PHOTOS WANTED OF BROWN'S CAMPUS
description:
Have awesome high-quality photographs of Brown's campus? Submit them to reach@brown.edu with the subject line
"Photo Submission" as soon as possible, and your photo could be featured on the cover of next year's student planner!You will receive credit on the cover.

We are looking for images of at least 300dpi that capture quintessential features of Brown. This means NO iPhone/Instagram quality photos. Portrait photos are preferred. You may submit multiple photos.

title: CFAR Special Presentation: Friday at 3pm
description:
Please join us for a Center for AIDS Research (CFAR) special presentation:

"From the National HIV/AIDS Strategy to Ryan White to Improved Population-Level Viral Suppression: Exploring Critical Roles for Researchers to Lead the Way"

Friday, Dec 7th at 3pm
Alpert Medical School
Case Study Room 275

Presented by Jeffrey Crowley: Distinguished Scholar and Program Director of the National HIV/AIDS Initiative at Georgetown Law, Director of the White House Office of National AIDS Policy, 2009-2011

title: Manage Stress Tip #3: Have a Snack
description: When you're busy it can be hard to find time to eat. But if you make it a priority to eat a snack every few hours and drink plenty of water, it will keep your blood sugar up, improve your brain function and energy levels, and make it easier to get through finals. Try it. Simple suggestions for stressful circumstances brought to you by Health Education. For more tips on reducing stress, click below.

title: Student Tickets for Men's Basketball vs Providence
description: From today until December 13, Brown Students can pick up their FREE student ticket for the men's basketball game against Providence College on December 28, at 7 p.m. Students should go to the Brown Ticket Office at Pizzitola Center and bring their Brown ID card. There will be only 200 tickets available for students and limit is 1 ticket per student. Students will have to show Brown ID with the ticket at the game. For questions, call 401-863-2773.

title: Re-Enact a Riot!
description:
Invite all of your friends to come act in or watch our Final Project for HIST 1030 Long Fall of the Roman Empire! We are re-enacting a pivotal moment in the rule of Eastern Roman Emperor Justinian, the Nika Riots. Come see violence and political intrigue, and maybe learn something too!

Kaspar Multipurpose Room at Noon on 12/8!!!

title: Unhemmed - last issue of the semester out today!
description:
Unhemmed Magazine is out today (Friday 12/7)!

Take a study break and click over to unhemmedmagazine.com to read the last issue of the semester!

Unhemmed Magazine is more than just a fashion magazine, celebrating Brown students' style, culture, and the arts.

title: IMPROVidence Presents The Last Show
description:
WINTER IS UPON US.

THE WINT'RY BLUSTERS BLOW US FARTHER FROM EACH OTHER.

COME THAW YOUR HEART WITH IMPROVIDENCE,
AND BID ADIEU TO DR. GAYBONES IN HS LAST SHOW.

"The Last Show"
Lower Salomon
Friday, December 7
9:30 PM
$1

(Unless you find Gabe before the show and give him a kiss, then it's free.)
(Unless he doesn't want you to kiss him, then it's a dollar anyway suckahs.)

title: Le Salon (French Conversation hours) Last Meeting!
description: Come practice your French speaking skills in a friendly, low-key environment one last time this semester with Le Salon. We'll be having our last fall meeting today, Friday December 7th, in JWW 303 from 5-6pm. All levels welcome. Food + beverages will be served. Nous serions ravis de vous voir.

title: Liman Public Interest Fellowship Campus Deadline
description: The campus deadline for the Liman Public Interest Fellowship is 5pm on January 7, 2013. This fellowship supports undergraduates who want to spend the summer working in the area of public interest law or to engage in advocacy work that shapes public policy. For more information about applying for the Liman, please click on the link below.

title: LGBTQ Center seeking LGBTQ Mentors
description: The LGBTQ Center is seeking lesbian, gay, bisexual, pansexual, queer, same-gender loving, transgender and gender queer faculty and staff mentors to participate in our Renn Mentoring Program. Anyone who identifies as LGBTQ+ is welcome to apply. We are especially in need of mentors who identify as people of color, trans, gender queer, bisexual, pansexual or men at this time. For information and an application please visit the link below or email Kelly_Garrett@brown.edu.

title: Come see Next to Normal
description:
Come see Musical Forum's production of
NEXT TO NORMAL

Book & Lyrics by Brian Yorkey
Music by Tom Kitt

Directed by Zach Rufa '14
Musical Direction by Ben Kutner '14

Winner of the 2010 Pulitzer Prize for Drama

Friday December 7th, 8 PM
Saturday December 8th, 8 PM
Sunday December 9th, 2 PM and 8 PM
Monday December 10th, 8 PM

In the Production Workshop Downspace @ 7 Young Orchard Avenue

Tickets available an hour before the show at the door.

title: iGEM Info Sessions: Do Syn Bio @ NASA!
description: Looking for a summer science internship that's innovative, fast-paced, high-stakes, and fun that comes with a stipend and the prestige of NASA?  Apply to be on the award-winning Stanford-Brown iGEM team.  We genetically engineer biological machines (synthetic biology), and are looking for biologists, engineers, computer scientists, etc.  Info sessions FRIDAY Dec 7 AT 4 and SATURDAY Dec 8 at 4 in Wilson 101.

title: Paper&Pixel Release Party Friday Dec 7!
description: Paper & Pixel, Brown's only photography magazine, will be having a release party this Friday December 7 in the Chandelier Room JWW501 @ 8 pm.  Come pick up our winter 2012 issue full of glossy photos featuring the best of Brown's photographers.  Cheese and crackers abound.

title: * * * TEACH IN PROVIDENCE WITH LEARNING EXCHANGE!
description:
Learning Exchange is a Science Center Outreach program that seeks to teach kids creative analytical thinking. We make games and animations in Scratch as well as paper planes and bridges. You'll get a chance to apply your skills in a real classroom -- it's a great way to get off College Hill and make a difference.

Apply now!

Sponsored by Brown Science Center.
(You can also email us at brownlearningexchange@gmail.com.)

title: MCM CIn�math�que presents films from the archive!
description: Join us for the last Cin�math�que screening of the semester! Help us close out the season with a strong attendance! Come to Production 101 in 135 Thayer Street (enter from Benevolent Street) this Friday, December 7th at 6:00pm for Ulrike Ottinger's TICKET OF NO RETURN (1979) and at 7:55pm for Mike Leigh's NAKED (1993). Screenings are always free and always presented in 16mm. The Cin�math�que will resume at the end of January, 2013.

title: PSAB Presents - Bilal Khan Concert: Live at Brown
description:
The Pakistani Students Association at Brown proudly brings to you Bilal Khan, the young Pakistani music sensation who has recently rocked every local music chart. Bilal is on his first US tour and we are proud to welcome him to Brown for a live event.

Friday, December 7
9:30 pm
Smitty B 106
Free Admission

title: One Million Bones: Bone-Making and Free Pizza!
description:
For International Human Rights Day, come by the Kasper multipurpose anytime from 12-2pm on December 10th (Monday)! We are making bones for the One Million Bones project. Click here to learn more and watch a short video:
http://www.onemillionbones.org/

There will be free pizza! We'd love to see you there.

Sponsered by STAND at Brown, GlobeMed at Brown, Brown in Burma, and the Brown Human Rights Report

title: Jonathan Strauss: From Erotics to Ethics...
description:
Please join the Department of French Studies for a lecture (in English) presented by Jonathan Strauss on Wednesday, December 12th at 5:30PM entitled "From Erotics to Ethics: Phantasmatic Remainders in Lacan, Blanchot, and Kristeva."

The lecture will be held in the Rochambeau House Music room located at 84 Prospect Street, a reception will follow.

title: Projects for Peace Campus Deadline - 1/11/13
description: The campus deadline for Projects for Peace is January 11, 2013 and is open to all undergraduates including seniors who would complete their projects after graduation.  Students are invited to design grassroots projects that they will implement during the summer. Brown will select among its internal applicant pool one proposal and one alternate proposal.  The two chosen projects from Brown will be submitted to the Davis Foundation. If successful the project(s) would be funded at $10,000 each.

title: Pharmacy Reminder
description:
The pharmacy will be closed from 12/22/12 through 1/1/13. Please plan accordingly and refill your prescriptions before the break as we will not be available to transfer your prescriptions during that time.

Thanks, Paul-Pharmacy 401-863-7882

title: Mark L. Shapiro Lecture Series in Philosophy
description: Please join the Philosophy Department on Friday, December 7 from 4:00 -6:00 p.m. for the inaugural Mark L. Shapiro Lecture Series in Philosophy, presented by Professor David Charles, Oriel College, Oxford. Friday's topic is "Practical Truth: Aristotelian Reflections." The talk will take place in Smith-Buonanno 106, with a reception to follow in the lobby.

title: Brown Madrigal Singers Winter Concert
description: Brown's only classical a cappella group warmly invites you to our winter concert, featuring carols, madrigals, polyphony, and much more! The concert will take place on Friday, December 7 at 8:00 pm in Manning Chapel and is completely FREE of charge. Please join us!

title: Office of Financial AId - Closes early on 12/14
description: The Office of Financial Aid will be closing early on Friday, 12/14/12 at 12:00 pm (Noon) for our Holiday Celebration. We will re-open on Monday 12/17/12 at 8:30 a.m. For urgent matters, please email us at financial_aid@brown.edu. Happy Holidays to All!

title: TODAY Cru Brown Dinner
description:
Join us TONIGHT 12/7 @ 6PM for a free, home-cooked meal and good conversation at the warm, historic Judson House (168 Lloyd Ave.). This week, we will be reflecting on this semester and planning for our international Christmas party. All spiritual backgrounds are invited.

Who: YOU
When: 12/7 6-8PM
Where: 168 Lloyd Ave. (2 blocks past CVS)

title: BROWN STAND UP COMICS Presents: The Alpacalips
description:
Come watch funny people be funny.

Brown Stand Up Comics is holding it's last show of the semester, the calendar year, and maybe even the world!

When: Friday, December 7 at 8pm
Where: MacMillan 117
Why: Becauuuuse.

title: Connect with Brown is Green!
description:
What percentage of Brown students recycle? How many tons of green house gas do we produce? How can I get involved with sustainability at Brown? Connect with Brown is Green on Facebook (http://www.facebook.com/JoinBrownIsGreen) for weekly tips and fun facts about Brown's energy and environmental initiatives.

Are you doing great green things in your student group or department? We want to hear about it! Share them on our page and you may even be featured in our annual sustainability report!

title: Learning Exchange Final Event
description: Learning Exchange is having a final ceremony for students today, 12/7 from 3:15-4:15pm in the Faunce Underground. Students will be presenting their final projects in Scratch and engineering/design. Anyone interested in STEM outreach in Providence is welcome to drop by (especially past teachers!).

title: FREE Contemporary Dance Workshop TODAY!
description: Body & Sole is hosting a FREE contemporary dance workshop TODAY, Friday, December 7 from 4-5:30 in Ashamu Dance Studio taught by SARAH-K, Artistic Director of Boston-based dance company STATIC NOYZE.  Relax and have some fun before finals really kick in and come take this sure-to-be-amazing contemporary class!  All dance experience levels welcome!  Bring your friends.

title: Weihnachtsmarkt: GERMAN Christmas Market TONIGHT!
description:
Weihnachtsmarkt: German Christmas Market!

Want to get into the holiday spirit? Please join the Brown German Club and DUG for Christmas Kaffeestunde and Weihnachtsmarkt, TONIGHT, Friday December 7th, from 5:00-7:00pm at 190 Hope Street! There will be fabulous music, great food, fun crafts, and an all around good time will be had by all. Pluse those who attend get to take home a gift! And who doesn't love gifts? Really? So come on out tonight and celebrate the Christmas season, German style!

title: Apply to the annual Consulting Conference at Brown
description:
Brown Collegiate Consulting Group is hosting a NATIONAL CONSULTING CONFERENCE on February 1-2, 2013 here at Brown. We are bringing together a SELECT GROUP of 120 students from universities across the U.S, as well as over 20 industry leaders and consultants, to educate, train, & inspire the best minds to pursue a CAREER IN CONSULTING.

Learn more about the event & submit an application to attend the conference at http://collegiateconsulting.org/#!/conference. Application deadline is DECEMBER 9th.
